articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Cambodian parties
Congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il from NDFSK central committee
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Cambodian parties 
       Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- The delegations of the Khmer Democratic Party, the Khmer Civic Party and the Khmer Combatants Party for Mulinaka and Liberty of Cambodia respectively visited the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh to congratulate General Secretary Kim Jong Il on his 57th Birthday.
   The delegations laid floral baskets before the portraits of the President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
   Party leaders said that General Secretary Kim Jong Il's birthday is a holiday common to humankind the Korean people as well as the world people should commemorate.
   Availing themselves of this auspicious opportunity, they sincerely wished a long life and good health to Kim Jong Il, supreme leader of the Korean party, state and armed forces.

articles.title: Chinese residents here visit Revolutionary Museum
Congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il from Chongryon central standing committee
articles.content:
Chinese residents here visit Revolutionary Museum
     Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Chinese residents in Korea visited the Revolutionary Museum of Kim Il Sung University on Feb. 15, one day before the February holiday.
   They laid floral baskets before the Statue of the great leader Kim Jong Il in the museum and paid tribute to him.
   They went round historic mementos and relics on display, being briefed on the great exploits performed by him through energetic ideological, theoretical and practical activities at the university.

articles.title: Floral basket and congratulatory letter from diplomatic corps
Talks between secretary of  WPK and Gen. Sec. of ICP
articles.content:
Floral basket and congratulatory letter from diplomatic corps
      Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the foreign diplomatic corps here on his birthday.
   the floral basket and congratulatory letter were handed to Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun by Nigerian ambassador to Korea Olugbenga Ayodeji Ashiru on Monday.
   He also received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the foreign economic and commercial councilors corps here and a floral basket from other embassy officials.

articles.title: Floral baskets, gifts and congratulatory letters from foreign diplomatic envoys and embassies here
articles.content:
Talks between secretary of  WPK and Gen. Sec. of ICP
       Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Talks between Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Rod Eley, general secretary of the Communist Party of Ireland (Marxist-Leninist), were held in Pyongyang on Monday.
   The two sides informed each other of their party activities and exchanged views on developing friendly relations between the two parties and a series of matters of mutual concern.
   The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Foreigners visit Third Kimjongilia Show Hall
articles.content:
Floral baskets, gifts and congratulatory letters from foreign diplomatic envoys and embassies here
    Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received floral baskets, gifts and congratulatory letters from foreign diplomatic envoys and embassies here on the occasion of his birthday.
   The floral baskets, gifts and congratulatory letters were handed to officials concerned by diplomatic envoys and embassies of China, Cambodia, Laos, Libya, India, Nigeria, Ethiopia, Russia, Mongolia, Pakistan, Egypt, Poland, Hungary, Vietnam, Indonesia, Cuba, Romania, Yugoslavia, Yemen and Palestine.
   He also received congratulatory letters from the acting resident representative of the UNDP and the head of the German interest section here.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il sends educational aid fund and stipend
articles.content:
Foreigners visit Third Kimjongilia Show Hall
     Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- The foreign diplomatic corps, military attaches corps and other embassy officials here visited the 3rd Kimjongilia Show Hall on Monday on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   That day Pak Kwang Gi, chief of the Pyongyang mission of the National Democratic Front of South Korea and its staff also visited the hall.

articles.title: Pyongyang youths and students meet
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sends educational aid fund and stipend
    Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent educational aid fund and stipend amounting to 114,030,000 yen for the development of the Democratic National Education of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan.
   The educational aid fund and stipend sent by the President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il for children of compatriots in Japan in 143 installments totaled 43,918,263,000 yen.

articles.title: Evening of Ministry of People's Armed Forces
articles.content:
Pyongyang youths and students meet
     Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Youths and students in Pyongyang met on February 15 to celebrate the 57th birthday of Kim Jong Il.
   Present at the meeting were Pak Song Chol and other senior party and state officials.
   First secretary Ri Il Hwan of the central committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League made a report. Then followed speeches of representatives of young people from all walks of life.   
   The reporter and speakers said the birth of the respected Marshal Kim Jong Il was the greatest fortune not only for the Korean people but also for humankind and a historic event which gave a sure guarantee for the accomplishment of Juche revolution and bright future of humankind.
   The Marshal is the destiny and future of the country and people and the symbol of victory, they said, and continued:
   All the youths and students should demonstrate the spirit of socialist Korea and exalt the new times of Juche revolution forever under his guidance.
   A congratulatory group of youths and students recited a congratulatory poem "Congratulations on February Holiday" at the meeting.
   A congratulatory letter to the marshal was adopted there.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun calls for ushering in new era of building of powerful nation
articles.content:
Evening of Ministry of People's Armed Forces 
     Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- An evening of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces took place at Jonsung Square on February 15 to mark the birthday of Kim Jong Il.
   Present were vice marshals of the Korean People's Army Jo Myong Rok, Kim Yong Chun and Kim Il Chol and others.
   The participants in the evening extended warmest congratulations to Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il, and danced a dance to the tune of a song "Congratulations on February Holiday."
   KPA vice marshals and general officers danced together with soldiers to the tune of "Comrade Kim Jong Il, Lodestar," "Glory to the Dear Leader," "Let's support our Supreme Commander with arms" and other songs, making the evening more cheerful.

articles.title: Floral baskets laid before Statue of President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun calls for ushering in new era of building of powerful nation
       Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today runs an editorial calling for ushering in the new era of the building of a powerful nation through great monolithic unity.
   The monolithic unity of Korea serves as a driving force for bringing about great changes in the building of a powerful nation, the editorial says, and continues:
   The perfect unity between the great Kim Jong Il and the Korean people is invincible because it has been forged and consolidated in a protracted and arduous struggle.   
   His history spanning more than 50 years is that of a people's leader who has formed a harmonious whole with the people, breaking through storms of history.
   He has always led the Juche cause to victory, with firm belief in the Korean people and officers and men of the People's Army, and the people have pulled through difficulties, believing in the former.
   The pure harmonious whole which has grown in strength in this course will remain unchanged, come what may.
   The monolithic unity is the eternal common destiny whereby the leader defends the fate of the people and the people defends him devotedly. It is very instrumental in safeguarding the country and the revolution and ushering in the new era of the building of a powerful and prosperous nation.   
   The faith of the Korean people in the ongoing struggle for the building of a powerful nation is that there is neither them nor a powerful nation without him.
   The monolithic unity is a source of creating something out of nothing and of effecting a second Chollima great upswing.
   The building of Korea into a socialist powerful nation is not an empty talk nor a thing of the distant future. The Korean people is crowned with the might of ideology and unity with which any material and economic potentials cannot stand comparison. The monolithic unity makes the people forerunners of creation and miracles who have nothing impossible.  It makes a nation a powerful nation who makes a bold attack in face of whatever adversity.
   The Korean people, who rallied close around him with one ideology and purpose, will surely follow up the "arduous march" with a cheerful advance and build a Juche-based powerful nation in this land to be envied by the world people in a few years to come.

articles.title: Joint national meeting of KCU organisations
articles.content:
Floral baskets laid before Statue of President Kim Il Sung
      Pyongyang, February 16 (KCNA) -- Working people, soldiers of the Korean People's Army and youths and students laid floral baskets before the Statue of the President Kim Il Sung on the lunar New Year.
  Floral baskets, bouquets and flowers in the name of the organs, organizations, factories, enterprises, farms, educational institutions and families were laid before the President's Statue on Mansu Hill today.
   Many people visited the President's statue in Pyongyang to express their unbounded reverence for him.
   Working people  from all walks of life, KPA soldiers, youths and students across the country laid floral baskets, bouquets and flowers before Statue of the President today.
